info.title: Integration API
info.description:
Integration API

# Responses and Error States

   The following HTTP response codes are used:

    + 2xx - success
    + 400 - Bad request.
    + 401 - Unauthorized
    + 403 - Forbidden
    + 404 - Resource not found

## Response 2xx

  Success

## Response 400

  Check that username/password are provided.

## Response 401

  Could be one of the following:
    + The supplied username is not found.
    + The password entered is not correct.
    + There have been too many failed attempts from this IP address within a certain time frame.
    + The username and/or password supplied are/is empty

## Response 403

  Could be one of the following:
    + The IP address is not allowed access.
    + The supplied user is not "Web Services Only" role.

## Response 404

  The path or the supplied resource id was not found

servers.description: Replace server with your instance domain.

post.description:
Create a new session token that can be used to authenticate later requests. In order to obtain credentials,
you must create Panel Management user with permission `API only`.

session_key.description:
The `session_key` value returned in the response can be used as the `sessionKey`
parameter in `DELETE /api/integration/sessions/{sessionKey}`.

400.description:
Bad request.   
Check that username/password are provided.

401.description:
Unauthorized.   
Could be one of the following:

  - The supplied username is not found.
  - The password entered is not correct.
  - There have been too many failed attempts from this IP address within a certain time frame.
  - The username and/or password supplied are/is empty.

403.description:
Forbidden.   
Could be one of the following:

 - The IP address is not allowed access.
 - The supplied user is not "Web Services Only" role.

delete.description: Terminate an existing session by invalidating a `session_key`

401.description: Access token is missing or invalid

404.description: The supplied resource id was not found

post.description:
Deprecated call, please use: `POST /api/integration/sessions` instead.
Login to the System Integration API. In order to login you must have create Panel Management user with type System Integration. This function returns sessionkey when successful or zero (user not found). If the login fails for any other errors the standard error is returned.

force.description: Force the login, in case you already have an active session.

panelid.description: Panel ID for selecting the correct panel.

error-0.description: The supplied username is not found.

value.error: Login credentials invalid. Make sure the username and password are correct, and that the user is assigned the "Web Services Only" role.

error-1.description: The password entered is not correct.

value.error: Login credentials invalid. Make sure the username and password are correct, and that the user is assigned the "Web Services Only" role.

error-2.description: The supplied user is not "Web Services Only" role.

value.error: Login credentials invalid. Make sure the username and password are correct, and that the user is assigned the "Web Services Only" role.

error-3.description: The username and/or password supplied are/is empty.

value.error: You must supply a valid username and password

error-4.description: The IP address is not allowed access.

value.error: Weâ€™re sorry, but access to these web services is not allowed from your IP address.

error-5.description: There have been 5 failed attempts from this IP address within the past 15 minutes.

value.error: Too many failed login attempts. Account locked.

post.description:
Deprecated call, please use: `DELETE /api/integration/sessions/{sessionKey}` instead.
Logout system integration user. This function will delete the current session for security purposes. It is highly recommended to call this function at the end of each connection.

post.description: Schedule campaign for the panelists. Campaigns are typically used to send email invitations to the panelists.

startTime.description: When to start sending out invitations.

includePortal.description: Whether or not to display this invitation to portal members.

pointsCompleted.description: Amount of points a panelist will receive upon completion.

pointsQuota.description: Amount of points a panelist will receive when quota terminating.

maxParticipation.description: Amount of times a panelist is allowed to participate.

pointsTermination.description: Reward panelist every time he participates or only the first time.

items.description:
An associative array indexed by localid consisting of associative arrays of |
message data with the structure of 'label'=>'answer'

content.description: Message content (must be CAN-SPAM compliant http://www.ftc.gov/spam/)

locale.description: The corresponding locale ID for this message or an array of locales.

example.subject: Test Email 2
example.content: This is the Second Test Email.

sampleids.description: A zero based array of sampleids to include in the invitation launch.

post.description:
This call works similarly to `integration.campaign.create`, but it also allows for creation of links that will
show up in the community. It is available as of version 4.6.0.1854 (released on July 26th 2016).

startTime.description: When to start sending out invitations.

messageTypes.description: Message types used by campaign. An array consisting of email and/or (if available) sms, or an empty array for community-only campaigns. (Default: [email])

includePortal.description: Whether or not to display this invitation to portal members

pointsCompleted.description: Amount of points a panelist will receive upon completion.

pointsProfile.description: Amount of points a panelist will receive when profile terminating.

pointsQuota.description: Amount of points a panelist will receive when quota terminating.

maxParticipation.description: Amount of times a panelist is allowed to participate.

pointsTermination.description: Reward panelist every time he participates or only the first time.

communityMessages.description: An array of community messages. These values are displayed to community users and are always required, even when the campaign is not published to any community.

messages.description: An array of invitation messages (email and/or SMS). Not required when publishing to the community only.

sampleids.description: An array of sample IDs (obtained via integration.sample.create)

communityMessages.communityContent: Receive up to 100 points for taking this survey!

communityMessages.communitySubject: Encuesta de mejoras para el hogar
communityMessages.communityContent: Recibe hasta 100 puntos por completar esta encuesta!

encStr.description:
This string is submitted via URL to the current "Receiver URL for landing pages", which is configurable on the "Community settings" page in the Community manager.
The incoming URL parameter is called: "kslp" and is safe for submitting via URL. It must not be altered in any way.

A datapoint label and a value must be provided to run the check.

post.description:
Deprecated call, please use: `GET /api/integration/panels/{panelId}/panelists` with a filter parameter instead.

Read panelist data from the Panel Management database. By default, this call will return all panelist system
fields (see example below), unless the optional datapoints parameter is supplied. If the optional datapoints
parameter is supplied, the call will return only the requested values (if found). Please note that question labels
and system field names are case-sensitive.

# NOTE:
It is ALWAYS recommended to specify "indexType" when making this call. If "IndexType" is not specified and
the panel allows numeric identifiers for panelists, this call could not find the panelist or find an incorrect
panelist.

index.description: The pid or identifier to lookup the panelist by

datapoints.description: Array of datapoint labels or panelist fields to return

indexType.description: The type of index being used

localid.description: The localizationid, or language code of the panelist.

subscribed.description: Whether the panelist is subscribed or not.

email.description: The email address of the panelist.

blacklisted.description: Whether the panelist is blacklisted or not.

modified.description: The most recent date/time the panelist was updated.

created.description: The date/time the panelist was created.

first_participation.description: The date/time of the panelist's first participation.

last_participation.description: The date/time of the panelist's last participation.

first_invitation.description: The date/time of the panelist's first invitation.

last_invitation.description: The date/time of the panelist's last invitation.

unsubscribed.description: The date/time that the panelist was unsubscribed.

timeblacklisted.description: The date/time that the panelist was blacklisted.

timeunblacklisted.description: The date/time that the panelist was unblacklisteed.

timereferred.description: The date/time that the panelist was referred.

first_completed.description: The date/time that the panelist first completed a survey.

last_completed.description: The date/time that the panelist last completed a survey.

last_pointsearned.description: The date/time that the panelist last earned points.

last_surveyscreened.description: last date/time that the panelist profiled or quota termed

responserate.description: The number of responses out of the number of invites in a certain period of time (usually 90 days).

completionrate.description: The number of completes out of the number of invites in a certain period of time (usually 90 days).

invited.description: The number of surveys the panelist has been invited to in a certain period of time (usually 90 days).

responded.description: The number of surveys the panelist has responded to in a certain period of time (usually 90 days).

completed.description: The number of surveys the panelist has completed in a certain period of time (usually 90 days).

md_invited.description: The number of surveys the panelist has been invited to.

md_started.description: The number of surveys the panelist has responded to.

md_completed.description: The number of surveys the panelist has completed.

md_screened.description: The number of surveys the panelist has profiled or quota termed.

md_finished.description: The number of surveys the panelist has finished.

md_referredpanelists.description: The number of panelists this panelist has referred.

points_earned.description: The number of points the panelist has earned.

points_available.description: The number of points the panelist has available for redemption.

points_redeemed.description: The number of points the panelist has redeemed.

points_survey.description: The number of points the panelist has earned from completing surveys.

points_referral.description: The number of points the panelist has received from referrals.

points_other.description: The number of points the panelist has received from an administrator.

post.description:
Deprecated call, please use: `POST /api/integration/panels/{panelId}/panelist_datapoint_reports` with a filter
parameter instead.

Read multiple panelistsâ€™ data from the Panel Management database. Depending on the amount of panelists and
datapoints that must be retrieved, this call can take a few minutes to complete. It will, however, immediately
return a token that can be used to check the status of the process and verify whether there were any issues.

By default, this call will return all panelistsâ€™ system fields (see example below), unless the optional
datapoints parameter is supplied. If the datapoints parameter is supplied, the call will return only the
requested values (if found). Please note that question labels and system field names are case-sensitive.

panelist.description:
An array of panelist identifiers to retrieve. Invalid / non-existent identifiers are
omitted in the result. (Default: all panelists)

datapoints.description:
An array of datapoint labels or panelist fields to include. Invalid / non-existent
datapoints or panelist fields are ignored and not included in the result.
(Default: all panelist fields)

token.description: A token which can be used with integration.token.get to check the status of the operation.

post.description: Update a panelist data

settings.description: A zero based array of associative arrays, with a size equal to the number of settings the user wishes to initialize. Settings are listed below. Email or Identifier required.

label.description: A valid datapoint label or panelist field.

name.description: The answer to set for the label.

post.description:
Update datapoints for multiple panelists.
Depending on the amount of panelist records that are being changed, this call can take a few minutes to complete. It will, however, immediately return a token that can be used to check the status of the process and verify whether there were any issues.

settings.description:
An array of panelist records you wish to update.
Each "row" represents a single panelist and must contain label/answer objects.
The included labels must match for all panelists in the list.
The panelistâ€™s identifier or email address must always be included.

label.description: A valid datapoint label or panelist field.

post.description:

# Note

It is ALWAYS recommended to specify "indexType" when making this call. If "IndexType" is
not specified and the panel allows numeric identifiers for panelists, this call could not
find the panelist or award points to an incorrect panelist.

post.description:
Gets the currently set panelist contact frequencies. # Note It is ALWAYS recommended to specify "indexType" when making this call. If "IndexType" is not specified and the panel allows numeric identifiers for panelists, this call could not find the panelist or return points from an incorrect panelist.

**Notice:** Panelists don't have a contact frequencies record by default.

SMSFrom.description: The time when it is acceptable to start sending SMS to the panelist.

SMSTo.description: The time after which the panelist does not wish to receive SMS.

post.summary: Returns a list of all rewards
post.description:
Deprecated call, please use: `GET /api/integration/panels/{panelId}/rewards` with a filter parameter instead.
Returns a list of all rewards a panelist has received for participating in surveys.

success.description: Retrieving the contact frequencies was successful.

data.description: Array of reward for the selected panelist.

points.description: The amount of points that were given.

date.description: The date and time when the points were given.

projectid.description: The ID of the project that was completed.

get.description: Results are ordered by created time descending. Newest panelists are returned first.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Pagination parameter for cursor based pagination

joined_at.description: Unix timestamp of when the panelist opted in.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp of when the panelist opted in.

first_participation_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of the time when the panelist first participated in a survey.

last_participation_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of the last time when the panelist participated in a survey.

first_invitation_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of the first time the panelist received a survey invitation.

last_invitation_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of the last time the panelist received a survey invitation.

unsubscribed_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of when the panelist unsubscribed.

blacklisted_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of when the panelist was blacklisted.

unblacklisted_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of when the panelist had its blacklisted status removed.

referred_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of when the panelist was referred.

first_completed_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of when the panelist completed their first survey.

last_completed_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of when the panelist completed their last survey.

last_points_earned_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of when the panelist earned their last points.

last_survey_screened_at.description: Unix timestamp representation of the last time the panelist was screened out from a survey.

invited.description: Number of surveys the panelist was invited to.

started.description: Number of surveys the panelist started (regardless of whether they finished).

completed.description: Number of surveys the panelist completed.

screened.description: Number of surveys the panelist was screened out from (profile/quota).

finished.description: Number of surveys the panelist finished (completed/quota/profile).

referred_panelists.description: Number of times the panelist referred somebody else (regardless of outcome).

points_earned.description: Number of points earned by the panelist since they've joined.

points_available.description: Number of points currently available to the panelist.

points_redeemed.description: Number of points used for redemptions.

points_survey.description: Number of points earned by taking surveys.

points_referral.description: Number of points earned by successfully referring other panelists.

points_other.description: Number of points obtained through other means (administrative, signup bonus).

400.description: Supplied property was invalid. The error message should return more information about what went wrong.

401.description: Access token is missing or invalid

404.description: The supplied resource id was not found

get.description: Results are ordered to show most recently created survey activity first.

parameters.name: filter[status]
parameters.description:
Filter by activity status.
Valid values are:
- pending
- invited
- started
- profile
- quota
- completed

To filter by multiple statuses, provide them as a comma separated list.

Single status.description: Get only activities which resulted in a complete.

Multiple statuses.description: Get only activities where panelists clicked the invite.

parameters.name: filter[status_changed_at][gt]
parameters.description:
Filter the `status_changed_at` timestamp by values greater than what you provided.

Expected value is a Unix Timestamp.

The `gt` filter value is not inclusive, i.e. it is not "greater than or equal".

Example 1.description: Get only activities which occurred after (but not including): `1619560879`.

parameters.name: filter[status_changed_at][lt]
parameters.description:
Filter the `status_changed_at` timestamp by values less than what you provided.

Expected value is a Unix Timestamp.

The `lt` filter value is not inclusive, i.e. it is not "less than or equal".

Example 1.description: Get only activities which occurred before (but not including): `1619560879`.

400.description: Supplied property was invalid. The error message should return more information about what went wrong.

401.description: Access token is missing or invalid

404.description: The supplied resource id was not found

get.description: Results are ordered by id descending.

parameters.description: Pagination parameter for cursor based pagination

400.description: Supplied property was invalid. The error message should return more information about what went wrong.

post.summary: Export datapoints/system fields for a known list of panelists by identifier
post.description:
Export all answers for the list of datapoints and panelists provided. Instead of returning the results in the
response, a report is generated with a url of where to download it from.

panelist_ids.description: An array of panelist identifiers to retrieve data for. Invalid / non-existent identifiers are omitted in the result.

datapoint_labels.description: An array of datapoint labels or panelist system fields to include. Invalid / non-existent datapoints or panelist fields are ignored and not included in the result.

201.description:
Ok.   

The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `reportId` parameter 
`GET /api/integration/panels/{panelId}/panelist_datapoint_reports/{reportId}`.

report_url.description: URL where to download the finished report (only set when `status` is `complete`)

400.description: Supplied property was invalid. The error message should return more information about what went wrong.

401.description: Access token is missing or invalid

404.description: The supplied resource id was not found

get.summary: Load a report by its id
get.description:
The result includes the status of the report and a URL where the report can be downloaded.
The generated report will be in CSV format.

report_url.description: URL where to download the finished report (only set when `status` is `complete`)

post.description: List all Projects.

data.description: An array of objects, each of which is a project containing project data.

status.description: Project status. Projects marked as 'completed' are returned as 'open' until they are closed.

completed.description: The date and time on which the project marked as completed. Null, if the project was never marked complete. "Completed" projects will not allow panelists to start new sessions, but will allow additional completes until the defined grace period (Default: 2h) has passed.

closed.description: The date and time on which the project was closed. Null, if the project was never closed or has been reopened. Closed projects will not allow panelists to start new sessions or finish them.

created_by.description: The user who created the project.

categories.description: An array of category IDs that the project belongs to. (Category IDs can be obtained by calling integration.category.listing)

post.summary: Get session info using the sessionkey
post.description:
Get session info using the sessionkey. The return values contain basic data about the session,
including project ID, campaign ID, panelist ID, status, start time etc.

sesString.description: 16 character panelist session string from the URL

error-0.description: Session with supplied session string is not found.

error-1.description: Session has expired.

value.error: Session has expired. You must start a new session.

error-2.description: Session is not found for supplied session key.

error-3.description: User ID not found for supplied session key.

error-4.description: Session key is not in correct format.

post.summary: Update the session status using the sessionkey
post.description:
Update the session status using the sessionkey. Optionally reward points can be distributed.
Distributed points will also link the points to the panelist session. Note: Specified reward points will override
any other default point values in the campaign manager.

sesString.description: 16 character panelist session string from the URL

status.description: Set the status of the completing panelist.

points.description: Optional to supply custom number of points

note.description: Optional to supply custom reward points activity note; note is only saved if a non-zero points value is provided or the campaign is set up to issue points for the status that is provided.

error-0.description: Session with supplied session string is not found.

error-1.description: The project is closed and status cannot be updated.

error-2.description: The campaign is expired and status cannot be updated.

error-3.description: The panelist is opted out.

error-4.description: The supplied status is invalid. The status must be one of the following: "profile", "quota" or "completed".

error-5.description: The supplied status in valid. The panelist must have a started status before changing it to this status.

value.error: Somebody is trying to go from status: â€˜(current panelist status)â€™ to â€˜(status)â€™ while bypassing 'startedâ€™

error-6.description: The supplied status is invalid for panelist.

value.error: Status can only be set higher than its current value of â€˜(current panelist status)â€™

error-7.description: The supplied status is invalid. The panelist is pending and their status can be changed to invited only.

value.error: A pending session can only be changed to 'invited'

error-8.description: The panelist exit status is already recorded. Their status cannot be changed.

error-9.description: The supplied points value must be positive.

value.error: Session has expired. You must start a new session.

post.description: Get a list of available surveys for a panelist.

index.description: Panelist ID or identifier to look up the panelis.

indexType.description: The type of index being used

subject.description: Email subject that was used in the invitation.

status.description: 'started' if the panelist has started, but not completed the survey, otherwise NULL.

time.description: The time this portal invitation was sent.

points.description: The number of points awarded for a completed survey.

url.description: URL to take the panelist to the survey, as defined in the project.

type.description: The type of invitation that was used. If the type is not available (portal launch only), this field will be NULL.

endtime.description: The time when the campaign expires and the survey links will stop working.

invited.description: The time when the panelist was invited.

data.subject: You have been invited to take part in a Sample Project.
data.body: This survey is about your favorite type of car.

post.summary: Get status of long running process
